seq_command module¶

seq_command.py is part of the KalAO Instrument Control Software (KalAO-ICS).

seq_command.AO_loop_calibration(**seq_args)¶

  1. Close shutter

  2. Move flip mirror up

  3. Set laser intensity to ‘intensity’ parameter

  4. Start cacao calibration

  5. Set laser intensity to 0

Parameters:

  • q – Queue object for multithreads communication

  • intensity – float

  • kwargs – supports additional arguments

Returns:

nothing

seq_command.check_abort(q, dit, AO=False)¶

Blocking function for exposition time Check every sec if Queue object q is empty if not, then an abort is required. Break the while sleep

Parameters:

  • q –

  • dit –

Returns:

nothing

seq_command.config(**seq_args)¶

Updates database with configuration parameters received from EDP.

Parameters:

seq_args – dictionary of paramaters received

Returns:

seq_command.dark(**seq_args)¶

  1. Turn off lamps

  2. Close shutter

  3. Take ‘nbPic’ dark picture of ‘dit’ exposure time.

If an error occurs, stores the status of the sequencer in ‘ERROR’, otherwise stores it in ‘WAITING’

Parameters:

  • q – Queue object for multithreads communication

  • dit – float for exposition time

  • nbPic – number of picture taken

  • filepath – If filepath is not None, store the picture to this path

  • kwargs – supports additional arguments

Returns:

nothing

seq_command.dark_abort()¶

Send abort instruction to fli camera and change sequencer status to ‘WAITING’. :return: nothing

seq_command.end()¶

End of instrument operation, go into standby mode :return: nothing

seq_command.focusing(**seq_args)¶

  1. Turn off lamps

  2. Move flip mirror down

  3. Open shutter

  4. Select filter

  5. Center on target

  6. Close cacao loop ?

  7. Monitor AO and cancel exposure if needed

  8. Take picture

  9. Close shutter

Parameters:

  • q – Queue object for multithreads communication

  • dit – float for exposition time

  • filepath – If filepath is not None, store the picture to this path

  • kwargs – supports additional arguments

Returns:

nothing

seq_command.focusing_abort()¶

Send abort instruction to fli camera and change sequencer status to ‘WAITING’. :return: nothing

seq_command.lamp_off()¶

Turn lamps off

Returns:

nothing

seq_command.lamp_on(**seq_args)¶

Turn lamp on

Returns:

nothing

seq_command.sky_FLAT(**seq_args)¶

  1. Turn off lamps

  2. Move flip mirror down

  3. Open shutter

  4. Select filter

  5. Take picture

  6. Close shutter

Parameters:

  • q – Queue object for multithreads communication

  • dit – float for exposition time

  • filepath – If filepath is not None, store the picture to this path

  • kwargs – supports additional arguments

Returns:

nothing

seq_command.target_observation(**seq_args)¶

  1. Turn off lamps

  2. Move flip mirror down

  3. Open shutter

  4. Select filter

  5. Center on target

  6. Close cacao loop ?

  7. Monitor AO and cancel exposure if needed

  8. Take picture

  9. Close shutter

Parameters:

  • q – Queue object for multithreads communication

  • dit – float for exposition time

  • filepath – If filepath is not None, store the picture to this path

  • kwargs – supports additional arguments

Returns:

nothing

seq_command.target_observation_abort()¶

Send abort instruction to fli camera and change sequencer status to ‘WAITING’. :return: nothing

seq_command.tungsten_FLAT(**seq_args)¶

  1. Close shutter

  2. Move flip mirror up

  3. Turn tungsten lamp on

  4. Select filter

  5. Take picture

If an error occurs, stores the status of the sequencer in ‘ERROR’, otherwise stores it in ‘WAITING’

Parameters:

  • q – Queue object for multithreads communication

  • beck –

  • dit – float for exposition time

  • filepath – If filepath is not None, store the picture to this path

  • kwargs – supports additional arguments

Returns:

nothing

seq_command.tungsten_FLAT_abort()¶

Send abort instruction to fli camera and change sequencer status to ‘WAITING’. :return: nothing

seq_command.waitfortracking()¶

Waits for the telescope to be on target

Returns:

0 or 1 depending on success pointing
